1F7TwMLszHAQIjaIvrKBnQ.text: First time, both my wife and I enjoyed our meals. I had a caesar salad, best ever. Staff was very friendly, place was very busy. Our pasta was homemade and we enjoyed the place.

vgyi_V6pWfp8D_ZwC34eyA.text: Zio is a great place to get flavorful Italian food at a reasonable price with a reasonably priced glass of wine or beer to accompany the food. The best part about Zio is that their food is flavorful without being overly salty and heavy. Their past dishes are outstanding. Their pizza is top notch. The grilled pizza is a special treat with a thin crust that is crispy. It is also a great place to take a family with young children.

lbEwW9RfRfGbFWiROV3F-w.text: Usually Zio would get 4 stars from me... If I had only gotten the Speedies, Zio would be getting 5 yelp stars Today!  Last night as usual the Speedies were fast and great ,Perfect, really!  The House made Fetticunni was very good, though the Marinara was way too watery and not as rich in flavor as it is sometimes.  The service was great!    The dessert was Chocolate Cake made in house I'll rate the cake at 1.5 yelp stars to be generous!  Of course I would return because it has been so good in the past and this place has great potential to be romantic!

photos.caption: Photo of Zio Casual Italian - Charlotte, NC, United States

0Zdn7ZKlFlC3dpUvbA_zrA.text: I've recently relocated from upstate ny and have been super nervous to attempt pizza in Charlotte. I've never actually left a review for a place but this experience has been less than ideal.   The first issue was that we ordered online. The confirmation email stated what time out order would be ready. Showed up within 5 mins of estimated time and they never took the order off the printer.  The only reason I didn't leave two stars is because there was a complimentary beverage for my friend for the inconvenience.   I ordered the caprese salad- this was a nightmare. I order this type if salad most places I go and this was definitely quite disgusting. The tomato (or 2/3 of a tomato) I got had definitely been refrigerated for at least a few days. It was pale orange and mushy. There were also like three tiny halved cherry tomatoes of equal refrigeration tossed in. Strange. The dressing (oil and balsamic ) was left in separate containers to add in myself. The only issue is that the balsamic was the consistency of motor oil. Not ideal.   We also ordered a plain pie. It was ok. Very very thin crust, a little undercooked on the bottom.   Overall I would say I wouldn't waste my time here for the pizza and don't even think about wasting the $7 or so bucks on that caprese salad.

VJC3bQVBwiNZgSm8Xzm_mA.text: Just had the pizza but it was GREAT  Update: I've now tried a variety of dishes here and it never disappoints. I'm a True New Yorker and Italian food like this is hard to come by in Charlotte.

5QxYsrLkNCgED6H_lhavIw.text: Great family-owned Italian spot! I tried the spaghetti with meatballs, chicken parmigiana, side house salad and chocolate cake. I'm quite critical with restaurants, but I have only positive feedback. I will be coming back here in the near future. Keep up the good work.

UKNwWgJfKEQsZF_kGVqqtg.text: Hey- Jason b- I'm the server that took over your table when you demanded a different server. I would like to say that it would have been nice if you let me know your pasta was dry cause I would have gotten you something  different- sorry about that. Our pasta is usually really good. It was after 9 which means we had already closed. We all really care about your experience and do our best. On a side note calling my co worker Marc an ogre is completely uncalled for. He's super knowledgeable about the menu. He works his butt off and couldn't be a nicer person. He's also smart and funny. You should be aware that these reviews are often read out loud at work meetings. Keep it about what we can improve- constructive criticism. Not what server is attractive enough to serve you. :(

cUXlQFoee2kQOSVWPv7KvQ.text: Awesome food. I went with the Cajun pasta and was very impressed. My suggestion is to go on off days because the seating and staff can't do crowds.

PSR9fU51-gqeOmjgCBRRtw.text: My favorite new neighborhood place for sure. I am not a fan of thick pizza, even coming from Chicago :) This place has amazing thin crust brick oven (smoky flavor and all) pizza. Service with a smile and very cozy. Its pretty casual, so great for family and friends.   I'm looking forward to trying new items. The sauteed spinach pizza was amazing...even over pepperoni!

i2KJ-MP80YUx6zlnhbGFgw.text: Nice surprise. Wanted someplace quick and tasty before a movie at the Manor. Chicken Piccata was well prepared, veggies were nicely cooked and the service was attentive and friendly.    Zio will be on my casual dining list. Decent price, good food, what's not to like.

Of4k8aXa7EaFlOo2XoX52Q.text: So pleasantly surprised by this place. First time I went we ordered the grilled pizza with sausage and it was absolutely delicious. We couldn't stop talking about it. Their house salad was delicious too. I had a craving for meatballs tonight and decided to order a salad and a side of meatballs. These are the best meatballs I've ever had in my life after my grandmothers. SO good, a MUST have.

aKtrb6qIrBHq0OXEKdFR4w.text: My favorite Italian place in Charlotte. Great food and not very expensive. My favorite is the spaghetti with meatballs. Haven't tried their pizza yet, but hear it's really good as well.

yoQc8Fr50zSYtyM7Vmh-Mg.text: The old "5 Steps Down" location! Love it. Awesome neighborhood spot. Fantastic pizza every time I have been. Service is hit or miss - maybe a staffing issue not bad talent. Nonetheless everything I have had here is great. Half price bottles of wine couple week nights.

5CcGEbrI6D8VJskyLC8NGw.text: On my Italian quest, I decided to give Zio a try with my 'I love pizza' 3 year old.  I tried the Grilled sweet sausage pizza because of the reviews and it was pretty darn good, but I wasn't a big fan of the grilled crust.  I think I will give it another try but go with the new york style.

photos.caption: Photo of Zio Casual Italian - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled sweet sausage pizza

wZd3nnMG6ed4dRHjbD86lQ.text: I've been here twice.  The first time was a "5".  The last time was a "3".  So for now I'm giving it a 4.    We ordered two dishes.  One pizza which was excellent and one pasta dish which was horrible.  If you get some crappy dry pasta at Harris Teeter, dump some store bought tomato sauce on it, you then would have the dish that we were served.  It sucked.    The service was horrific.  Our initial server appeared to have Ogre DNA.  I say that from both an aesthetic standpoint and from an intellectual point of view.  We waited and waited.  Then he asked "Are you ready to order?".  We enthusiastically said "Yes!" as we had been waiting for a while.  He then walked away and after another 10 minutes passed I asked for a different server who was very good.  It's not as though the place was busy with it being after 9PM at this point.    It's too bad.  I really liked this place a lot initially.  But now I won't be rushing back.

OPmyLPd2W-QHcZ8ARiDx8A.text: My meal was delicious- the others in my party were satisfied with theirs.  My only gripe about this place was our long wait for our food. However, the waiter took care of this issue and gave us half off.

RTtgIxRxaPav4qgQZMjIcQ.text: Awesome! Been here a few times. Sat at the bar for drinks and food. Wine list is good as well as the service. Grilled pizza is delicious and one of the best chicken parm I have ever had. Definitely recommend!!

Ms8i7Poi6n9Lg72cxKPgpw.text: When to Zio for a quick dinner the other night. This was not my first time coming to Zio as it is one of the quicker casual Italian restaurants in Charlotte. We got the Eggplant Parmesan and the Baked Penne. Both dishes were great and the eggplant came with homemade fettucine. Coming from an Italian family and Italian restaurant family, I am usually quite critical of italian restaurants, but Zio has a traditional style. The server was very nice and friendly and tenative which also made the food that much better. Next time I will try the pies and pizza!  Tutti mangiamo!

g_on0_j0Zv7aSBeHg9aVqg.text: I stumbled onto this place while in town for a conference and stopped in for dinner. What an amazing find. Warm, friendly, family-style Italian place. The home-made pasta was tremendous, as was the Chicken Parmesan... After, I had a cannoli, which was also excellent.  Highly recommended for anyone who craves an easy-going, well-made Italian dinner...

RfsYuhLok55-CUHdA1xTCw.text: I've been searching for CLT's best pizza and finally made the visit to Zios.  Unfortunately it was just average.  Not bad, but not sure I would go back again just for the food.  First, when I walked in there was an awful smell... kind of like dirty wet dish rags and reminded me of a dive bar bathroom.  Okay, after 5-10 minutes you get used to it, and we were sat near the door so maybe its not so bad elsewhere in the restaurant.  Either way, its a bad smell and needs to be corrected.  On to the food... I read most of the reviews to figure out what best to order... started with the harvest salad (pretty good - I would recommend), then we got the angel hair pasta with meatballs (not bad, but nothing special) and then we got the grilled pizza (not my fav).  The pizza was supposed to have mozarella cheese, but it was so salty and was either not mozarella or was a very cheap one, like the kind that pizza shops use when they are cutting corners on cost.  I had high hopes, but the pizza let me down.  For now, I'll stick with Pure Pizza until I find one better.

nyfk3YjLYvh3otPtkiDqbA.text: Zio is a neighborhood favorite for us. I like to try something different each time I go (typically seafood/chicken + pasta) -- like shrimp & spinach with wine sauce. I recently tried the glutton free pasta and it was really good. I like how they have a fresh pasta selection as well. I have found that the vast majority of dishes do not disappoint. Zio's gets extra points for their incredible bread.   Zio's is a nice little neighborhood Italian restaurant with an old school vibe - especially the cool oversized bar area. The restaurant is sectioned off into a bar area & booth seating on the left (I like to think of it as the adult area) and a louder family friendly area on the right. I count Zio Casual Italian among the best Italian Restaurants in Charlotte for a consistently good, affordable meal. And, the bread.

18hjxCDWET4tLbuObOcWog.text: We went excited to try a new Italian place since we have driven by it quite a bit and have also seen reviews for it. As soon as we walked in we were hit by an uncomfortable heat wave. It was hovering around 60 degrees outside. Uncomfortable but we suck it out.   We were seated at a booth that was uncomfortably small for two people and entrees on the table at the same time. We proceeded to order two pizzas since we assumed they were small personal pizzas. Once I looked around at other pizzas I realized the pizzas were 14" and there was no way two of the could fit on the table and it would be way too much for two people.   After canceling our second pizza after the debacle, we ordered the prosciutto and arugula pizza and the goat cheese dip. The goat cheese dip came out and I was very disappointed. Goat cheese is already creamy and it came out melted looking like a clam chowder. Nothing would stick to the pita points served with it. It had decent flavor but the texture was horrible. The pizza, on the other hand, was really good and the prosciutto was nice and salty. I would definitely like to go back since I think it can be better but I don't know when that will be. I really wanted to like it.

_02XSMgu1cXMwkUeLOVkjA.text: Likes: Good neighborhood location, decent food with fresh herbs used from their own garden located behind the restaurant and good prices   Gripes: Service is mediocre, tends to be too hot in the restaurant in the summer and cold during the winter and the booths are uncomfortably small

_F1My5ZvQgO8I9js7408rA.text: Sometimes the best places really are the ones you'd never expect it from.  So the dinner group is trying another "new to us" restaurant at Zio.  The restaurant is below Primo in Myers Park.  It's not a fancy place and described as casual Italian.   The decor is simple with paneled walls and a little brick.  There's a bar to the left side of the restaurant, booths along the walls of the restaurant and tables in the open spaces.  There are few tables outside on the patio.  The menu is simple with pizzas, salads, pasta selections  and a few Italian entrees.  I went with one of my favorite Italian dishes, Chicken Piccata and a side house salad.    The salad was beautiful.  Shaved parmesan cheese on top of mixed greens and a few chunks of tomato with a homemade Italian dressing.  Absolutely delicious also.  The Chicken Piccata was a breast of chicken on top of angel hair pasta in a very light lemon, caper sauce.  There were a few veggies for a garnish on the side.  This has to be the best Chicken Piccata I've ever had.  The chicken was tender and was plain.,.not covered in flour and fried like many places do.  And the sauce was so light.  They even gave you a lemon wedge if you were craving more flavor.  My mouth was singing!    For dessert, someone said we needed to try the chocolate cake.  And they were right.  This cake was wonderful.  A light frosting covered a dense and moist chocolate cake.  But I also heard the tiramisu was really good also.  Service wise, our server was fantastic.  Every order was spot on and she explained specials and had no issues with splitting the bill for 9 people.    Definitely need to come back here.  This is by far, the best casual Italian place in Charlotte.

UiulGLSN9yy6DE4CFYyZgQ.text: The special of: Corvina, sauteed spinach, rice and a perfect glass of wine was the best part of my Friday night. The food is delicious and the wait staff is both serious about the food and service. I also enjoyed the stuff mushrooms as my app. Neighborhood friendly (many who know one another) and friendly to newcomers as well. Casual style dining. And I noticed a lot of take out as well.

0BH9h-lX7Z4e4McMS5gNKw.text: Zio, I wanted to love you but your rambling ways turned me away.  The food I must say was fine but the service was just like a soup sandwich.  The cheese pizza was pretty fabulous and the grilled arugula salad I had was equally good.    No matter the food you have to figure out how to train the wait staff.  We had no less than four people visit our table which isn't the issue.  The issue is that none of them really took ownership of said table.  I went without my second drink due to just plain forgetting to get it via the waiter.  Generally slow service.  Figure that out and you've got a good gig going.

KR5ZwlfKmo1LDk-mh8OM7A.text: Me likey!!  Let's be honest...I think the real reason I liked this place is because it felt like I was walking into my grandma's kitchen.  She is old school italian and has some of the same creepy black and white photos of random Italian families hanging on her walls...And her house has the aroma of garlic 24-7.  :)  No, seriously...I was impressed with Zio.  I don't eat Italian out very often because I prefer homemade sauce and pasta.  I am an Italian food snob because I come from an italian family...sorry, just being honest.  But, Zio was pretty decent.    I liked the atmosphere...as I described earlier..I expected grandma to walk out of the kitchen at any moment.  It is a low key, casual environment...which is great.  I went with the basic angel hair and meat sauce with meatballs dish.  It was very good.  The sauce was a little tangy and maybe slightly too salty for my taste but it was good and homemade so I can't complain.  The meatball was very good as well.  It was also homemade and had a lot of flavor.  My dining partners tried the Penne Vodka and the Salmon Piccata and they were very impressed.  The vodka sauce was a little runny but it still had great flavor and a ton of fresh cut garlic so that was awesome.   The bread they serve with your meal was very good but I will say the herb infused olive oil was a bit bland.  We had to add salt and pepper so it didn't just taste like vegetable oil.  I am questioning if they ran out of olive oil and just served us something else.  Not sure...  I hear the pizza is the way to go with Zio and I will definitely be back so that will be the next thing I try.  But, overall, I think it is a good, down-home, authenticish Italian restaurant here in Charlotte.

RkfMZATBcMKyep7TxHCM-A.text: Excellent  Food perfection Service Delightful  Wine list good Would defiantly would return and recommend to all

wnuLnU_vs409q06Yb7PSPg.text: Don't get pizza from here unless you are prepared to hate any other pizza you eat forever. Papa johns in particular will taste like a mouthful of greasy cardboard compared to one of Zio's hot pies.   Also half off on wine bottles Monday and Tuesday can't be beat.

BDpRsVGR9HgDlmTWodSlPA.text: This place is a good Italian restaurant. The last time we went it wasn't to good but last night it was great. The shrimp scampi hit the spot! My wife wants it again tonight. I love this place because it's not to expensive. I'm surprised at the people that complain about how their prices have gone up. Hello, have any of y'all been to Olive Garden the fast food of Italian? This place is a good small place with great food!  If your into chain restaurants than go to Olive Garden but if your into good food go to Zio!

fiictbIFY2007uFHJF1eHQ.text: Zio is a tiny nook of a neighborhood place that serves casual Italian pasta, pizzas, and a handful of entrees in a very family friendly atmosphere (though they do have a bar) that is well-patronized by the local Myers Park and Eastover neighborhoods.  The location of Zio can make it a bit hard to find..  as you have to head down a set of shallow stairs to access it, with another restaurant up on top.  Being on an otherwise residential street is also a bit of a challenge, and on busier nights you will likely need to park on the street as well.  Once inside, though, you'll find a comfy, warm atmosphere - plenty of tables and booths on both sides of the place.  Do note that there is an early dinner rush here as parents get off work and look to bring the crew in for dinner.  Waits are common on Friday and Saturday,  The tables themselves come with a large helping of Italian bread, complete with a dipping oil.  Glasses of drinks are quite large and there is a nice selection of beers here, both local and imports.  As to the menu, it's stocked with salads, entrees, and pizzas of both the grilled and the baked variety.  Just don't go overboard with the toppings here- they get pricey pretty quickly and this is not a place that offers combos deals like the major chains do (but this is a good thing).  You'll find a handful of appetizers too, but I recommend you check out their specials on the chalk boards,  as there are always some good finds here.  Everything here is done pretty well, and their pizzas have a nice, thin crust with plenty of chew to keep things most and not brittle.  I even enjoy their salads and there are some good combos here- especially with roasted pear and creamy be cheese.  Service is generally good, though servers can get caught up quite quickly with the rush should you happen to stop in during a busier time.  However, this is not a white tablecloth place and things are a bit more relaxed.  For casual Italian with great pizza, this is a great choice.

WPVZ8pnixiOltg-5Zpwn1g.text: Two friends and I decided to check out Zio since it was near the bar that we would be going to after for a football game! We had checked out the Yelp reviews before and were pleasantly surprised when we ordered and received our food.  We started with the calamari and it was amazing. We're pretty big sticklers on calamari but this one didn't disappoint. Next, I had the goat cheese/strawberry/mandarin orange salad dinner special and it was amaaaazing. The fried goat cheese was perfect and I was so happy I had ordered it.  My two friends both got really large pizzas for $11. They were really good also and we were all stoked on the great food we received. The prices are relatively inexpensive and the waiter was very friendly and was always attentive to us. I would definitely recommend Zio to anyone looking for quick, affordable and super yummy food!

liho5qfdZcxm7Ilb1DDyFQ.text: Zio is the epitome of a neighborhood restaurant.  It is off the beaten path, a casual meeting place with outside seating.  Zio has a warm feeling when you walk in the door, I mean the whiff of garlic knocks you down, heat pouring out of the kitchen, it is very comforting.   Even if you haven't been there, you know you have found a gem.  I have been a couple of times with large groups, great for ordering a lot of food and eating family style.  I love ordering a large pizza for an appetizer. YUM cheese overcooked please.   I went for lunch once and they told me they didn't serve pizza at lunch, that was a little mind boggling.    Maybe we should have our first 2010 CLT yelpers at Zio!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Zio Casual Italian - Charlotte, NC, United States

hjakTrSCb2OwcSadIj7JGw.text: I used to love this place when it was Five Steps Down. I haven't been there since.  I decided to give Zio a try for takeout a few weeks ago. My wife and I agree that they have some of the best pizza in town.   Perfect size for a larger appetite: 12" pizzas.  The salads are OK, nothing great. But the pizzas are awesome.   Like Five Steps, it has that hidden neighborhood gem feel to it.

JJXg9kMAQODJbG5GLQjjPA.text: Thursday evening..service was horrible, didn't even bother to ask if we wanted a salad, served coffee that was cold--twice!  Meat sauce was dry and lasagna was all cheese, very little sauce. Overall very disappointed in our meal. Will try one more time since In the past food and service were good.

Lgj_m_9tEsuRcvJcTyXlDQ.text: Went for my birthday and had a wonderful time!  The fried ravioli was great and our golden beet salad was delicious.  I recommend subbing in one of their fresh pastas in whatever dish you order, it was amazing!  Pizza was also good.  I ordered a slice of chocolate cake for dessert and my server (Amanda) brought it out with a candle and sang!    Will go back for sure.

_iduA4l7eZluIFvGakVJ2w.text: Good place for the family. Nice neighborhood feel. Food is good and reasonable too. Staff is always friendly.

VySmYA94p26U8sAD-JDRpg.text: Very tremendous. Absolutely delicious every time I go. In my top 3 of all Charlotte restaurants.

sx9HrhkFrtmjQsjoZTRATg.text: I met a friend for a late supper last night at Zio and had the lasagna which was as beautiful to look at as it was delicious.  The sauce was so fresh and the pasta was cooked perfectly and layered with super thinly sliced meatballs and ground sausage and LOTS of cheese and was very, very yummy!  He had a bolognese dish with homemade noodles that were very good!  I also sampled a beef spiedies appetizer (thanks for the name fellow yelper!)  that was very tender and cooked and seasoned perfectly!  We enjoyed a beautiful deep purple blackberry gelato served with a flaky biscuit like pastry and strawberries (minus whipped cream at our request) as our dessert and LOVED it!  The ambiance is very unassuming yet quaint and the restaurant was full on a Wednesday night - always a good sign!  Our waiter was attentive and made some great suggestions and admissions of some menu items that were better than others in his opinion!    A great first experience to Zio and I would recommend it and try it again!

Photo of Zio Casual Italian - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bolognese with homemade pasta

TdSV3UKw_rv-Jq6jTilpZA.text: Usually no complaints here but tonight we called in an order and was told it would be 20mins. We arrive a little after the 20min mark and it's not ready. Took them over 40 mins to get out food ready. Very disappointed.

DUQ0jOrvkZBtwRdvPNrKxw.text: After trying several times I finally got my chance to enjoy a meal here. I was delighted with the warm friendly ambience. The menu made everything sound incredibly delicious but having heard about their awesome Pizza I knew I had to try it. After a very tasty shrimp appetizer our Pizza arrived. There was no disappointment in what my expectations had been. I loved the thin crust and the balance between the cheeses and the vegetable toppings. Nothing overwhelmed but everything blended into the perfect combination. The wait staff was very attentive and knowledgeable and checked with us frequently for refills and feedback on our meal. I would love to come back and try some of their other entrees but it will be hard to resist the pizza!

7vGxiCZB7Nn8YENCTnWCyg.text: Zio is my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. It took me forever to find a good Italian place down here, and once I found Zio, it became my go-to spot. Have been going for years now and have never had a bad experience. The grilled pizza is thin and crispy, the arugula salad is fresh and delicious, and I don't know what they do with the frosting on their chocolate cake, but it's amazing. I rarely stray from these things on the menu but when I do, I'm never disappointed. The prices are also extremely reasonable. The atmosphere is casual and it allows the wait staff's personalities to complement their attentive service. I'll stop ranting now about how much I like Zio, but please do yourself a favor and try it out.

5ZuJbxJFD6IBoFuaW7XKaQ.text: I went to this location yesterday and there seem to be a growing trend in Charlotte.  As I walked in there was a waiter with his bowl of pasta sitting beside him at the front in plain view.  He is eating and waiting on customers.  I know this is a City of Charlotte code violation, Safe Service violation and a sanitation one.

vEDV9BpCpqXwUrMS4xebmQ.text: This quaint place is awesome!  It's clearly a neighborhood hang out but even though we are not regulars we were treated as such.  Classic Italian fare, like Italian in the 90's.  family atmosphere but only on one side other side is more adult. Always great service, I mean always and awesome food, give them a try, you won't be disappointed

PmA52dyMVNRGmeUU0Z11eg.text: Great little place. There were 3 of us.  We started with the calamari. Very tasty.  Nice sauce drizzle on top. Marinara sauce too.  Hubby had the lasagna. Huge piece and super tasty.  Their marinara sauce is delicious. I had one of the specials.  Shrimp Florentine w risotto cake. Yum.  Good amount of big juicy shrimp. Risotto was delicious- crispy outside hot and moist on the inside. My friend was so excited to see speidees on the menu. She's from endicot NY and felt like she found home. She can't wait to go back!  She had the chicken piccata and loved every bite.  We saw lots of pizzas go out the door so the must be good and a neighborhood favorite!  We did try desserts. Hubby had tiramisu. Different than usual but still tasty. Chocolate cake was dry for me but friend liked it. My only wish would be to see more Italian wines by the glass on the menu.

P0jqOLw41e1Bqb2NfOj1Pw.text: Service has gone downhill and not sure if I'll be back. I think our waiter was high or just out of it as we would have to flag him down and he was bouncing all over the place. For lasagna and wine I can think of better places when service is factored into the equation.

s8IW6Ifl4PfNwqesrQue_A.text: I'm not even going to suggest certain foods because I've YET to find anything less than wonderful at Zio! I've lived littereally next door to the restaurant and as a bachelor! dine there frequently!         The owners and much of the staff are actually Italian and they make their food with love. I've been sick lately and despite not delivering they have made special exceptions for me. (I'm 100 feet away though so don't think you will get that privilege!)           Also, it's both family friendly and the divided dining rooms leave space for adults to sit at the bar or a cozy booth.            Bottom line! I give them 5 stars! If you've never been, don't wait any longer!!  Mark A

eFgGELc-p4sIhkm30wbj8A.text: One of my new favorite Italian restaurants! It has a nice family casual feel, very welcoming and comfortable. The food is delicious too! We had a pizza and the spinach and beans entree (soooo good)! The service was on top of it too. I can't wait to go back.

WhdTtAtuCejPwu2nAyZ56A.text: I'm not sure why I don't come here more often (aside from input from my waist). Zio has that charm of an old school Italian restaurant in a big city basement and high quality food with great service.   Started with the toasted ravioli which were crispy and savory, with a marinara that tasted homemade. For the main course, had the grilled pizza special, spicy chicken sausage with mushrooms. The flavor was awesome and the size + having it square cut allowed for a tasty cold breakfast the next day.   Our waitress was super friendly and very attentive without hovering. Only negative was the outside seating was closed for a "private party," but the inside was quaint and cozy enough to make up for it.   That's amore!

BfmqsaeLMOZGTWjSiKWkNw.text: Got their summer risotto and house salad, which was delicious. Spectacular service to go along with as well.

v_GEqqsn9AgAXWME0VXOSA.text: My husband and I came with our daughter for the first time tonight. Our brother and sister-in-law came to meet us for a drink at the bar while we also had a drink and waited for our to-go order. The bartender, Crystal came from the other side of the bar to talk with us. She was kind, took our drink order, to-go order, etc. the other lady named Kristen could not have been more unwelcoming or rude to us.   After enjoying a glass of wine with our family while waiting for our to-go order, after about 15 minutes or so, we were asked to leave because children are not welcomed in the bar area. Our one year old daughter was sitting on our lap not making a sound but I'm assuming Kristen didn't feel we were ordering enough and wanted our seats taken for other customers so told us we had to leave. She seemed to be frustrated after my sister-in-law who is very pregnant didn't order a drink. To say this was distasteful is an understatement. She told us we needed to leave because we were technically breaking a law, but us being there for 30 minutes prior was no big deal. Our brother and sister-in-law are both attorneys and said there is no such law that exists.  I have worked in the service industry for over 10 years, have my own business myself, and have never felt more mistreated or uncomfortable. To say Kristen made a scene was an understatement. I have always been told Zio was a family establishment, but I can promise you I will encourage my friends and family to never attend this restaurant.  We are natives of Charlotte and semi new to the neighborhood. We have been excited to try your restaurant but were extremely disappointed. We left with a terrible taste in our mouth and will never be returning.  I hope this message is passed along to the correct person so that Kristen can hopefully never make anyone feel this uncomfortable again.  Sincerely, Caroline

QMmeiFrEowuOinRoVRykuQ.text: Zio is one of our favorite Italian restaurants in Charlotte. Good food, good service and convenient.  I've usually get the lasagna, chicken Parmesan or Spaghetti ala Zio. My only disappointment was that I got the baby arugula salad that is supposed to come with grilled asparagus on it and the salad only had two small pieces of asparagus. Definitely wasn't worth the $7 for the salad.

6R-3bAAzHlSteGk3v0RQIg.text: This is a wonderful Italian restaurant. The pizza, chicken Parmesan, salmon Parmesan,spaghetti ala zio were all delicious. Each dish was flavorful and made us feel warm and cozy. I Will definitely be back for more yummy food.

uS7__nNVtmFflk8Aye7Wyg.text: This was one of my least favorite restaurant experiences. I was excited to have some good Italian food based on friends' advice, but was disappointed to be served partially cooked chicken, breading on the chicken that fell off, and a pasta dish that lacked pasta itself. When complaints were made to our waitress about our food, the waitress was unresponsive and hardly offered to make our meal better. A few of the people in our group ordered Shirley Temples, but were served a fountain soda that had a mysterious red liquid in it which tasted terrible. The waitress rarely tended to our table, and at the end of our meal, one of us needed to use the restroom only to find the toilet clogged. We notified staff of the clogged toilet, but they blew off our concern and had poor attitude. Overall, the staff did not listen to our complaints and our food was far below standards. This evening made us not want to eat at Zio again.

dPlDpIo4jXMkU2fPz-hLNw.text: This is one of my favorite places in Charlotte. I'm going to be completely honest, I'm 100% biased to it because the original restaurant is actually from my hometown, from which I grew up 2 miles from. Not only the authentic recipes are the same from this little Upstate, New York gem, but the prices are reasonable and gives me a small piece of "home" down south.  If you're looking for True authentic wood fired pizza, Zio's is your best bet. I love their grilled arugla salad or daily specials. True italian! The staff is friendly, but a little slow. I recommend this at 4 stars because of their low beer/wine selection and limited seating. Otherwise, bring the kids for a casual sit down or grab a pizza to go and inhale!

rV3IZFT1JkqRHB5HeZfeFw.text: This was a nice surprise for din. I have never seen this place. Wasn't a long wait at all and we got there around 7:30/8ish. Sat in a nice small booth where out lovely server greeted us with a smile and joy. Had a great bottle of Chianti. Ordered the toasted ravioli for the appetizer. It was good, but just not my thing. For my entree I ordered from the seasonal menu. Roasted garden vegetable quinoa salad with grilled salmon. Got the balsamic glaze and lemon juice on the side. Wish I took a picture of this because it was delicious!!! One of the best pieces of salmon I have had in a very long time. Was served in a bowl with mixed greens, sweet potatoes, goat cheese, pecans, peppers & the dressings on the side (didn't even need them). The salmon was flaky and just so amazing. I was craving salmon so it was a great choice. Didn't give 5 stars only cause I'm not a big fan of italian in general.

O9QjsUxzVX_RqpwZLhRnqQ.text: Came here for New Years with a reservation. We were sat immediately. We waited a long time for our food but it was understandable. We never complained but turns out they lost our ticket and comped our food to half off. I couldn't believe they offered that especially with us not even complaining! The lasagna was huge and very cheesy. My only complaint is that I wish it had a little bit more sauce. My fiance thought it was just right. Never had their pizza but tables around us got it and it looked good!

FGTA91vxkGAR9--DIMIlag.text: Well, the secret is out. The jig is up.   Last night, we went to Zio and had a near 45 minute wait. While that isnt crazy, this used to be a place where you were almost assured a short wait for very good food. I am definitely happy for their success but miss when it felt like only a few people knew about it!   As far as the food, we both had pizza. The pizza, of course, was excellent. It's the best pizza in Charlotte!

In7KXjUIaLqHdBJlmPaWEw.text: Definitely a solid spot.  Second-best Italian I've had in Charlotte (behind Mama Ricotta's).    Pretty sweet setting, as well.  I dug the relatively casual vibe when I went.  And, restaurants in the Providence area all seem to have a pretty organic classiness to them.  I'd definitely go again.

kjQvWy1FSBVJK3fsSSNoeA.text: We ordered the toasted ravioli and it was so good.. I also ordered a warm quinoa kale salad and it had really great flavor. It's cool that they grow their own vegetables. I will definitely be back

kcJ2JSeJhiglSyS-3MyIBg.text: This place has never disappointed. This was the first time the hubs and I got takeout, so good. Their pizza with spicy chicken sausage, mushrooms and Gouda was amazing. We also had the harvest salad which was light, could have used more than two pieces of asparagus and roasted red pepper. I really enjoyed the lemon vinaigrette. Do yourself a favor and check Zio's out, it doesn't break the bank and it's great

hxweuxWD_38FYOe9eqClBg.text: Shrimp app was pretty good. Not too heavily breaded, which I liked. Goes well with the arugula and sauce.

gyBG75jb_JDsIHGLQO71PQ.text: Definitely a fan of Zio.  It's a bit tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Providence road, but once you find you way in, there's a pretty good chance you will find something delicious.  I love of comforting smell of Italian goodness and the warm feeling you get when you enter.  The space is interesting with a low ceiling and configuration since the building is older, but still makes for a cool mom and pop spot(in my opinion).  Don't have the history of this place, but you can tell it was passed down from a generation and dedicated to family loved ones.  This place always is busy when I go, which is a good sign.  The waitstaff is super friendly and always on the move due to the place being busy, but you never leave hungry.  Place is very family friendly.  Definitely fun to see kids enjoy pizza and pasta as much as I do.

RHvm6XgNrrIYW1LfdliXNQ.text: This was our first time at Zio and over the years I had only heard amazing things. My husband, son and I got there at about 6:30. We were seated immediately, however it took about 5-10 mins before anyone came to the table. Our waiter was brand new and had tables inside and out which You could tell had him a little flustered. We ordered a pizza for my son, lasagna and side salad for my husband and I ordered the meatball appetizer and side salad as my meal. The salads came out super fast and then we waited about 40 mins or so before anything else came out. In the meantime i stopped another waitress as I had not seen our waiter in quite some time and the table behind us who came about 30 minutes after us got there meatball appetizer within about five minutes of ordering. She must have grabbed the attention of our waiter as he stopped by a few minutes after and let us know he was sorry for the wait and the food would be out shortly. Finally the food came..The pizza was slightly warm and dried out, On the plus side, my husband's lasagna was a nice size and he enjoyed it. My meatball appetizer still was not brought out. Shortly after, the waiter brought over a plate of spaghetti and meatballs- not what I ordered! He took it back and about 10-15 mins later after apologizing he brought out the correct dish ..by then my husband and son were done eating. He did take the meatball off the bill and offered us a free dessert and 10% of the rest of our food. It was a nice gesture but still unfortunately a let down. To top it off a man rode his bike into the parking lot as we were leaving and asked us if he could have some of our leftover food... not the best ending to a $60 dollar meal with discounts, that's for sure:(

1OnZXlEp4XcUWfWHyEYRyQ.text: Came here a few days ago with a few fellow Yelpers....man, this place is the real deal! My husband and I definitely enjoyed mapping out our most recent Italian vacation on the place mats they have on the tables!  Pro tip- Tuesday is 1/2 wine bottles. Our table split some Pinot Grigio and Prosecco.   Off of Yelper Tonya P's suggestion, we ordered a cheese pizza as a tizer. I honestly don't know if I would have done this if Tonya didn't encourage it. However, I now am going to recommend this to everyone! Order the cheese pizza. Not a bunch of rando toppings on it. Just cheese. It's that amazing.   I settled on a side ceasar salad and a side of meatballs. My husband got the special for the day, which was angel hair pasta with a butter/white wine sauce and loads of seafood (shrimp, scallops, etc). His pasta was fantastic!! The shrimp in it were the jumbo shrimp, not the wimpy baby ones! My meatballs were easily the highlight for me. The flavor was so perfect. Everyone around the table seemed very pleased with their dishes!   We decided to split a few desserts for the table. I tried a bite of the cannoli (excellent filling), a bite of the tiramisu, and a bite of this lemoncello cake (perfection!).   Absolutely fantastic evening that was made even better by service. Our waitress may have actually been the sweetest woman on the planet. No exaggeration. Zio will definitely become our go to Italian from here on out.

4L-AeiZZkqvl7xSWXdxDEw.text: What a fantastic and unexpected surprise.  The slow cooked sauce with the lasagna was outstanding as was the authentic bolognese (I recommend having it with the angel hair as suggested by our server, Pippy).  Our dining companions ordered eggplant parm and it came with fresh homemade fettuccine and a wonderfully garlic marinara. I will be back the next time I'm in Charlotte (and most likely will have the bolognese again).

i1bfjoAFFT7_ue_GyAfWJw.text: Zio's is a great little Italian eatery that has many good offerings. The past is great, the pizza is great too. I have enjoyed the Chicken Piccata and the cannoli's are not to miss. This is a great place to go with friends because there is something for everyone on the menu. The decor has an Italian American feel that feeds your eyes while you feed your stomach.

qFDcfqlsWUPWm6yAWXUtNQ.text: Zio has been on my Bookmarks for a while now, and all I can say is I hate that I didn't get there earlier. We arrived for an early dinner, around 6:30, and got one of the last tables on the outside patio. Upon being seated we were greeted by our waiter, who was very friendly, and offered water and fresh bread, made at Nova's bakery. As we checked out the menu we observed a women working in their outside garden, where they grow herbs and vegetables, now that is fresh!  We started with the arugula salad, which was light and extremely fresh with arugula, asparagus and candied almonds. And, after seeing the other Yelp photos we decided to check out the classic cheese pie and a side of meatballs. The pizza, or pie as they call it, was amazing! The dough was cooked to perfection, with a light and fluffy crust, topped with just the right amount of cheese and herbs. As for the meatballs, OMG, they reminded me of my Italian grandmother's, served it a great marinara sauce.  The service was great, and although the restaurant is definitely old school it is a hidden gem with amazing Italian traditions. Cannot wait to get back and check out some of the entrees!

Photo of Zio Casual Italian - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar

MyAu3V4ikrthYhrJTuxDag.text: The best Italian food in the south, hands down. Jimmy did a wonderful job of recreating a copy of his famous New York State restaurant. The only thing missing is bread from Battaglini Bakery.

U8wUHdmSmVz4d181vXi2FA.text: Cozy and delicious!!! Their pizzas as well as their pasta dishes are out of this world. Love this place!

p15ukkyYgRy1lhhyN-dsaA.text: One of my favorite casual italian spots in Charlotte! Honestly everything on the menu is good. Their ceasar dressing is incredible, the tomato sauce tastes like my grandmothers, and the food is always great.

LHkUDWarJRJ7YhFJWaLUUQ.text: Just left this restaurant and I have never been more pleased. Our waitress went out of her way to make our experience incredible. The food was so fresh and came out in record time.  I will for sure be returning for seconds!

FzWBsO2xW4XFJYsitdVjHA.text: "Zio! Zio! Zio!" And the crowd goes wild!   Walk down the steps and into the warm and cozy nook that is Zio. Now inhale! Mmmmm! The first things you take in are the aromas. Someone is cooking something that you will want to eat!! Just play it cool though, and walk don't run to your table.  The Pizza - Cheese: wonderful sauce with intense tomato flavor layered with cheese. Spicy Chicken Sausage Pizza: large and in charge - smoky, spicy sausage and roasted red peppers - great savory combination.  The Main Courses - Chicken Piccata - simple and delicious - bursting with lemon, capers and butter, served with angel hair pasta. Now close your eyes and imagine if Eggplant Parmesan was an enormous vegetarian Ribeye, the thickest you've ever seen, fileted and stuffed with fresh ricotta and spinach - really an amazing dish. Now cover it with sauce, homemade pasta and mounds of cheese; yeah, it just got better.   The Cannoli - do what you must - even if it involves loosening your belt or undoing your pants. You must make room. Both the homemade filling and shells will leave you wanting more. Pop! There goes another button...  Zio, you can be my uncle anytime! I'll bring the napkins and you bring the food! Deal?!

-c-zlxKVGtQurNXYwV7ppA.text: Ordered takeout online around 6:30pm Wednesday. Order ready close to promised time (30 min). Dining room crowded and follks waiting as well. Hostess, take out folks and wait staff seemed very rushed. Figure kitchen must have been hectic else no creditable explanation for cold pizza, cold lasagna and sparse salad. Pizza thin crispy crust was strong on crispy but light on toppings. Sparse is the best description. Lasagna portion was ample. Sauce was watery. Layers of cheeses and meat were out of balance. Heavy on the noodles. Cheeses overpowered. Probably just an off night or at least bad night for take out. Dine in meals have been much better experience and if something was a bit off kitchen was there to fix it. No fix for take out.

86jEsQKCd294ZIxst6waGQ.text: This is the best pizza in Charlotte. Hands down! Perfect combination of cheese and sauce.

9uBs9aZ54bQYhsUojq7Iwg.text: Zio's has changed and not for the better. While the food is still good, they have reduced the portions significantly. The dinner entrees are less than lunch portions. This is ridiculous. When you order a dinner entree you expect a dinner portion. Their dinner pasta dishes arrive in lunch Size pasta bowls. We dined last evening with another couple . Two of us ordered pasta dishes and two ordered the vegetable plate special. The vegetable plate was extremely small. We left hungry and very disappointed. Zio's needs to serve dinner portions or inform and charge appropriately.

b7XAnFjTpC0dxhJ_tuendw.text: Very tasty, reasonably priced, great service, great location and fun, family friendly atmosphere! The pan-seared scallop special was phenominal, the chicken piccata was a winner and the fried ravioli appetizer was a great choice!

mMGi_c-sk2JVjKqVNR94Vg.text: This place has totally gone down hill. It makes me Sad. Take out is a joke, it takes twice as long as they say, its poorly packaged and you dont get as much as you do in house. They have gone up on their prices too which sucks. $11 for spaghetti and marinara - come on. I asked for extra sauce( because they never have ended enough, )  and they gave me a tiny side cup. Gee thanks. Totally not worth the $

photos.caption: Photo of Zio Casual Italian - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wow zios, thanks for the pasta. Where is the sauce?!! Dont waste your money

1SV-divWA57MIijEuF1kmA.text: We've been looking for a good, local Italian restaurant and we found it.  Zio was delicious!  Loved the sauce, portions were plentiful, and service was solid.  The cannoli were "meh" but everything else was excellent, highly recommend.

Isz2SXof1_t8o8He2bn7Mg.text: This was my first time visiting! The food was delicious. I ordered the angel hair and meatballs and if was wonderful. The bread and garden salad was so fresh and everything was amazing! The atmosphere is casual but really nice inside. I can't wait to come again!

95i0obU2Sdee4l-gh74C4g.text: First of all, can't believe I've never been to this cozy, little Italian restaurant in all the years I've lived in the Queen City! Thanks to being July's choice destination for Yelp's International Supper Club, I was finally able to check out this hidden gem.  This month's gathering was rather big, with maybe 15-16 members...but the restaurant had a perfect seating arrangement for us all by the wall.   We were served several big bowls and trays of Italian faves...starting with their amazing Cheese Pizza, followed by a little bit of everything! Since our host preordered various items off the menu and served up family-style, I'm not sure about the exact names...but there were 2 varieties of Pasta, Meatballs, Chicken, and Canoli. And even a bowl of Salad! All I can say is, YUM...for each and every item ordered!   And OH, I loved their "Italian Mule" mixed drink. Highly recommended!  I do think the restaurant could use a bit more space though. There seating area was a bit tight in the dining half of the restaurant...and it sort of has a closed-in (caved in?) feel to it.  Also, the AC could have been cranked up a bit more.  Still, the restaurant did a great job bringing out the foods so quickly and seamlessly...and big kudos to Tonya for putting this delightful feast together!   Afterwards, one of the waiters even gave our group a guided tour of their backyard garden.   Any fan of good, homestyle Italian food is sure to love Zio. It's all SO Delicioso!!

ISvzBWsG7HxEZQMXZ--cRQ.text: Zio has a warm, family feel and serves generous portions.  I got to try this place thanks to Tonya P aka the one and only PopRock Photog who set up a Yelp Supper Club. We started off with a cheese pizza appetizer. Yes, pizza as an app and it was delicious. Nice, thin crust and flavorful sauce. Winner.  We then tried the house salad. I'm not a fan of croutons but I was told theirs were quite good. Afterwards, plates of meatballs, penne alla vodka, maria rigatoni, and chicken piccata followed. Out of all of those plates, my favorite was the chicken piccata. The lemon wasn't heavy handed and it made the chicken fresh-tasting and flavorful. Definitely would order again on my next visit.   As a bonus, we got a tour of their backyard garden to see where some of their ingredients come from. Service was great, they kept our tables clear and drink full.

2osi-QyS_fzD_O-7ytXjGA.text: Zio Casual Italian lives up to its name with an emphasis on casual.  Not sloppy casual like McDonald's, but laid-back casual depending on the weather, the occasion, or the mood.  I like that I can wear either jacket and slacks, or a nice pair of shorts and sandals--both styles fit here.  Thanks!  I attended with a group of Yelper's as part of their International Supper Club.  The service was flawless for about 20 of us, as well as the food, which was served family style.  We started with pizza and ended with cannolis.  In between we gorged ourselves silly on salad, chicken picatta, meatballs, penne in a vodka sauce, and rigatoni in a cream sauce with mushrooms and spinach.  Wowzer, we ate well!  Afterwards, we had a private tour of their garden area out back.  I think Uncle Duff would be proud of the way we were treated tonight.  Ringing lots of bells on my "give 'em a whirl meter."   Looking for an authentic "gioia di verve?"  Go here.  Molte grazie!

c0x4UWGF7lBVY_Jrd8TtqQ.text: Came here with a group and settled into a booth. I like the televisions placed where they dont overpower the space. It's a lot bigger than it appears on the outside.   I tried the cheese pizza, and rigatoni with spinach and mushrooms. Lemon chicken too. All was great with my Riesling wine.   My server offered me a tour of the garden. With my love of gardening, I took him up on the offer. I love how they grow so much of their own herbs and veggies.   I will come back on a Wednesday so I can hear some jazz with dinner.

1wnQ02XgqHNfemv20bwlRw.text: We came here for Yelp International Supper Club and had a great meal.   We had a family style meal that started with some warm bread and olive oil. We got a cheese pizza appetizer, salad, penne ala vodka, rigatoni Maria, meatballs, chicken picotta, and canolis.   My favorite thing hands down was the pizza. So good. I usually get toppings, but plain cheese was really good. The penne ala vodka was pretty good too.   It was a ton of food for a great price. If you're looking for solid Italian at a reasonable price, this is your place.

tFHeUZUiH9yFKbJ-lQyEgA.text: A Charlotte classic truly the best Italian food in Charlotte maybe North Carolina as a whole. Pizza is phenomenal every pasta dish I've had is great and they are very accommodating with allergies. They offer gluten-free pasta and have a wine special on Mondays I believe it's half off a bottle! love when a local place is this good

p6NwYnpf9CWHfDswY7L7Gw.text: Let me start out with this. First walking in holy smokes that smell is just out of this world!! Nice little place inside it's small but does have it's charm. I probably wouldn't recommend coming here at peak dinner hours since it small and the food is Devine! Your gonna wait but it's worth it. I ordered the friend calamari and it was just cooked perfectly lightly breaded and not at all chewy just the way it's supposed to. I had the chicken piccata and just was so enjoyable, chicken was nice and tender and the white wine sauce was really good. Did I mention that thier pasta is homemade? If I didn't my bad because it is and your can tell by the texture there is no way on Earth it's store bought boxed crap Zios really knows how to make great food all around and just can't wait to come back for more!

jfANppix0o5LfvTKONCw0Q.text: Excellent homemade Italian food.   Food: -Grilled pizza with Italian sausage - crispy, cheesy, nice amount of toppings and fresh ingredients  -Angel Hair pasta with Bolognese sauce - I loved the fresh pasta! The sauce was primarily meat but also homemade. -Cannoli - great flavor and a nice size for 1-2 people depending how hungry you are after dinner  Service: Our waitress was friendly and attentive. She provided great recommendations.  Ambiance: It felt welcoming and like you were in Italy. You saw big groups of friends and family and people on dates. A lot of people were sharing their food. It's a casual environment. If you don't want to sit inside, they have a patio.

HUsAm5qMjtC8b1TWFVSLSQ.text: Very casual, relaxing ambience with reasonable, comfort Italian food that tastes fresh and very authentic. If you are going for drinks and desserts, then very minimal options.  Great service. Highly recommended and we will be visiting again.

zYVNvQoxlv2JitNm9gCneA.text: Props to the person who suggested the toasted ravioli. They were nice and plump, filling & very tasty. The nice surprise of the night was The Rigatoni Maria which had this light cream sauce that was outstanding. It wasn't so rich either, just the right amount to deliver solid flavor. Next time I might need to try the pizza that everyone raves about. All in all a nice little Italian spot in South Charlotte.

TeUmnJKpLacTWlxGm7wPwg.text: This was my first time at Zio's and my date and I were very disappointed. We were quickly greeted and seated our drinks were brought out promptly we were then informed that the restaurant ran out of bread. We were very surprised because it was still quite early in the evening and most Italian restaurants have bread brought to the table while you wait on your entree. I ordered the Eggplant Parmesan which was okay and he ordered the salmon piccata his salmon was under cooked and had to be sent back to the kitchen which of course made for an awkward dining experience since the point of eating out is so that we can eat together. When the salmon returned it was still under cooked so instead of sending it back again my date opted to suffer through his meal and had to eat around the salmon. When we left the restaurant he ended up throwing away his food and was upset about paying for a meal that he could not enjoy. Perhaps we should have requested a refund for his entree. On a positive note our server and the staff were very friendly.

uCGrvpx-_olnnFhogp0O3w.text: My boyfriend takes me to this place almost every time we visit Charlotte together. We LOVE it. My favorite thing about this place is the fact that all of their food is so fresh and made from scratch. We like to get the calamari to start off with, my bf usually orders the lasagna or gets a pizza and I get the chicken parm, and they are all amazing. The prices are very reasonable considering how much food they give you - I always have leftovers. The service has always been great and I've never had to wait on my food for a very long time. I think Zio is a great authentic Italian restaurant and I will continue to go there when I visit Charlotte!

egHohZXBfHTt7aKW52VQqw.text: The food was pretty good (I've had better eggplant parmesans), but it was not worth the wait. The service was so slow. We waited to get table bread for 10 minutes after ordering our entrees until finally we just asked our waitress who didn't even speak fluent English for bread. Otherwise who knows if the bread would have shown up before the entrees. Later, both of us asked for to go containers and she showed up with only one. Rather than wait for her to make her rounds and show up with another to go box, I just went up to the hostess and got one so we could finally get out of there. Dinner should not have taken that long.

xd42NoaUA4qdwgXwBVLoLg.text: We've eaten in the dining room and ordered pretty regularly via Postmates. Everything we've ordered has been a huge success.  This is now our bad day go to.  Both the hot & grilled pies are great. Pizza sauce is often overlooked but the sauces here are plentiful, varied & perfect. The spiedies(though not lamb/chicken that I'm used to) are champions.  Zio has our eternal appreciation.

3gboP5DbsI4c_T8eSlJJ-g.text: This was my first visit to Zio. And I'm going to admit that I might have gone to the wrong restaurant (upstairs) before I made it here. Don't be like me. :)   When I arrived there was already fresh bread and dips on the table. I'm a fan because they bring you two loaves of bread to start. Carbs are the way to my heart! I loved the red sauce that comes out for dipping! So good!   For dinner I ordered the toasted ravioli and a meatball. The ravioli was just okay. I missed the filling and expected them to be a little hotter fresher from the kitchen. My friend said they were normally not as skimpy so perhaps I just had a bad batch.   But the meatball was really good! I loved the flavors and the sauce. I could have just ordered these and been happy!   Overall, it's A-OK in my book. And I'd be willing to give them another try!

Photo of Zio Casual Italian - Charlotte, NC, United States. Toasted Ravioli

cFLWIhSUO_vkzzHB-pLGsg.text: I came here with a friend for dinner and we had a great time! The service was excellent and they were heavy on their wine pours (hear 1/2 off bottles on Tuesday!). I started with the fried goat cheese salad- note you can have them split it for you. The goat cheese was delicious and the perfect starter to any meal. I would definitely come back just to order the salad.   We decided to split a pizza. We did a BYO with the white pizza, but added chicken and artichokes. It was cooked perfectly and had great flavor. Next time I'll definitely get a pizza down the traditional route, but the white pizza sold me.  Zio is a great place for a casual night out and the staff is super friendly. I will definitely be back in the near future.

NgalxjhgTG4Yc_caqpwqUg.text: We love Zio's food! The grilled pies, the Arugula and asparagus salad (that sadly includes just 2 stalks of asparagus...) The stacked eggplant salad/appetizer.   We love the idea its a family business. In our neighborhood!  But the service. Yikes In person and on phone it consistently disappoints.   Stephanie. Plus the regular bartender. Hosts! They all seem to be in a constant state of inconvenience and or confusion   Darn!!  Came for the grilled pie. Cried over the service.

D50hBP6RqMjiR6Bvd5rsHw.text: Zio has been on my list for a long time (that's why I made it a point to put it on my #Yelps10FirstCLT list) and it definitely did not disappoint. Solid food and super affordable.   We had a group of nine for dinner on a Monday night. They don't really take reservations, but if you have a large group go ahead and call ahead to give them the heads up you're coming.   Yelper Tonya P has told me for years, make sure to get a plain cheese pizza as an appetizer when you go to Zio. Pretty good rule of thumb in Charlotte: listen to Tonya when it comes to food. We got two for the table and man, they were delicious. I would've never thought to order a plain cheese pizza here, let alone getting one as an app to share. Tonya for president. For my entree, I ordered the seafood pasta from the specials board. It was delicious and had a good amount of quality seafood in it. We also ordered cannolis, tiramisu, and lemoncello cake. The lemoncello cake was my favorite. I needed more than a couple bites, so I also got one to go.   On Mondays and Tuesdays, they do half price bottles of wine. Make sure to take note of the ones that qualify, look for the selections with the asterisk. Or, just clarify with your server ahead of time because not only bottles are on special.   Good food, great company and what made the evening even better- our server. Our ticket said her name was Deborah (so I hope I'm giving credit to the proper person) and she was just amazing. She took great care of us and was just fabulous to be around all evening.   Zio, I'm sorry it took me this long to come visit. I'll definitely be back. Get a cheese pizza ready for me!

photos.caption: Photo of Zio Casual Italian - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Zio Casual Italian - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cannoli
Photo of Zio Casual Italian - Charlotte, NC, United States. Guys, get a cheese pizza for an app. Seriously.

TTrcHfr-XZSjjvt1PuSWGg.text: Everyone deserves another chance, right? Well despite my troubles last visit here, I have always liked their food.  I haven't been since my last review so decided to come back for a try.  I brought my mom & my nephew and we arrived about 5:30.  We were greeted and seated right away.  Our waiter's name was Tim and he was exceptionally friendly and prompt.   I ordered the stuffed eggplant parm and a beet/fries goat cheese salad. The meal was delicious. The salad was decent although the dressing was a little on the sour side. I tasted one of my mom's meatballs and it was very good.  I was happy with this experience and glad to try this restaurant again.  I hope in the future I can make many trips back here.
